newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Hardie sells division to GWA.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Hardie sells division to GWA.

text.p: James Hardie Industries Ltd said on Friday it had sold its bathroom products division to GWA International Ltd.
Hardie said the sale would realise book value.

It said the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission would not oppose the sale of the Australian component of the business and the sale of the New Zealand component was subject to approval from the N.Z. Commerce Commission.
New Zealand-based Brierley Investments Ltd is the largest shareholder in Hardie with a 27.23 percent stake.
The bathroom products unit makes toilet suites, baths, basins, shower bases, taps and hot water heaters, which are sold under brand names including Fowler, Irwell and Hardie Dux.
It has annual sales of about A$100 million, employs 800 people and includes five manufacturing sites in Australia and New Zealand.
Hardie managing director Keith Barton said the sale would release funds for the expansion of the fibre cement, gypsum and systems businesses.
